Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: JKM Oracle Simple
AUTHOR: Oracle
DESCRIPTION This JKM provides simple journalizing procedures on Oracle tables When starting the journal on a model, tables no longer in the set are unjournalized, tables missing from the set are journalized.
REQUIREMENTS The DB user of the Work Schema must have a SELECT ANY TABLE privilege granted directly (not through a role)
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) - COMPATIBLE: Optimize the code for a version of the Oracle database. - VALIDATE: Checks the settings of the KM
LIMITATIONS - If the table is already journalized and is present in another model, the current journal data will be lost and the table is transfered to the new journal set. - This Knowledge Module creates triggers on your source tables. Be sure to validate the scalability of your applications before releasing your developments in your production systems. - This Knowledge Module does not support LOBs. Please use Streams based JKMs instead.

This option affects the use of PURGE key word and the way statistics are collected:
Values PURGE STATS 10 Yes DBMS_STATS 9 No DBMS_STATS 8 No ANALYZE

This option generates an extra validation step during development. Validations performed are: - validation of KM option COMPATIBLE - validation of RDBMS version of the database
This option should be turned off for all production use in particular for high-frequency execution. There is not added value in production, only processing overhead.
This option must be set to False for generating WebServices.
Note : Execute this this grant as sys to modify the permissions of the target data server schema
grant select on v_$parameter to <user>;

create or replace view <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("JRN_FULL_DATA_VIEW")%> /* This view is created in the work physical schema of the current Data server */ as select decode(TARG.ROWID, null, 'D', 'I') <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN_FLAG, JRN.JRN_SUBSCRIBER <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN_SUBSCRIBER, JRN.JRN_DATE <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN_DATE, <%=odiRef.getColList("", "JRN.[COL_NAME]		" + odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD") + " [COL_NAME]", ",
	", "", "PK")%> <%=odiRef.getColList(",", "TARG.[COL_NAME]		" + odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD") + " [COL_NAME]", ",
	", "", "NOT PK")%> from ( select L.JRN_SUBSCRIBER <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN_SUBSCRIBER, <%=odiRef.getColList("", "L.[COL_NAME]	" + odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD") + " [COL_NAME]", ",
			", ",", "PK")%> max(L.JRN_DATE) <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN_DATE from <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("JRN_FULL_NAME")%> <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> L group by L.JRN_SUBSCRIBER, <%=odiRef.getColList("", "L.[COL_NAME]", ",
			", "", "PK")%> ) <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN, <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("FULL_TABLE_NAME")%> <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> TARG where <%=odiRef.getColList("", "JRN.[COL_NAME]	= TARG.[COL_NAME] (+)", "
and	", "", "PK")%>

delCmd = """ delete from <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("JRN_FULL_NAME")%> <%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN where JRN.JRN_SUBSCRIBER = ? """
# Prepare the delete prepDelStmt = myCon.prepareStatement(delCmd)
# Execute it for each subscriber for sbs in lstSbs: prepDelStmt.setString(1, sbs) nbRows = prepDelStmt.executeUpdate()
prepDelStmt.close()
# Commit updates myCon.commit()

delCmd = """ delete from <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("SNP_JRN_SUBSCRIBER")%> <%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> SUBS where SUBS.JRN_SUBSCRIBER = ? and SUBS.JRN_TNAME = '<%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("FULL_TABLE_NAME")%>' """
# Prepare the delete prepDelStmt = myCon.prepareStatement(delCmd)
# Execute it for each subscriber for sbs in lstSbs: prepDelStmt.setString(1, sbs) nbRows = prepDelStmt.executeUpdate()
prepDelStmt.close()
# Commit the updates myCon.commit()

<% if (new Integer(odiRef.getOption( "COMPATIBLE" )).intValue() < 9 ) { %>
analyze table <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("JRN_FULL_NAME")%> estimate statistics
<% } else { %>
begin dbms_stats.gather_table_stats( ownname => '<%=odiRef.getInfo( "DEST_WORK_SCHEMA" )%>', tabname => '<%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("JRN_FULL_NAME").replaceAll("","").replaceAll("..>",".replaceAll(odiRef.getInfo( \\u0022DEST_WORK_SCHEMA\\u0022 )+\\u0022.\\u0022,\\u0022\\u0022)?>")%>', estimate_percent => dbms_stats.auto_sample_size ); end;
<% }; %>

import java.sql as sql import java.lang as lang
# Connect to the Source Database ie the one that hosts the journalized tables myCon = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("SRC")
# Create the list of Subscribers for a CDC Set lstSbs = [] <%= odiRef.getSubscriberList("" , "lstSbs.append('[SUBSCRIBER]')", "\n", "") %>

<% if (new Integer(odiRef.getOption( "COMPATIBLE" )).intValue() < 9 ) { %>
analyze table <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("SNP_JRN_SUBSCRIBER")%> compute statistics
<% } else { %>
begin dbms_stats.gather_table_stats( ownname => '<%=odiRef.getSchemaNameDefaultPSchema( "W" )%>', tabname => '<%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("SNP_JRN_SUBSCRIBER").replaceAll("","").replaceAll("..>",".replaceAll(odiRef.getSchemaNameDefaultPSchema(\\u0022W\\u0022)+\\u0022.\\u0022,\\u0022\\u0022)?>")%>', estimate_percent => dbms_stats.auto_sample_size ); end;
<%}; %>
Alter subscribers table for V3 comp

alter table <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("SNP_JRN_SUBSCRIBER")%> add ( JRN_ROW_COUNT <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_NUMERIC", "20")%> null, JRN_DATA_CMD <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_VARCHAR", "2000")%> null, JRN_COUNT_CMD <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_VARCHAR", "2000")%> null )

if #V0 < <%=odiRef.getOption( "COMPATIBLE" )%>: raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-ORA-10000", "ODIKM-ORA-10000: You are using RDBMS version {0}.{1}. This version does not support IKM COMPATIBLE={2}.", ["#V0","#V1",<%=odiRef.getOption( "COMPATIBLE" )%>])

/* This query returns the COMPATIBLE setting of the RDBMS */ select case when upper(name) = 'COMPATIBLE' then to_number(substr(value, 1, instr(value, '.',1,1)-1)) else null end v0, case when upper(name) = 'COMPATIBLE' then to_number(substr(value, instr(value, '.',1,1)+1, instr(value, '.',1,2)-instr(value, '.',1,1)-1)) else null end v1 from v$parameter where upper(name) = 'COMPATIBLE'

create table <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("SNP_JRN_SUBSCRIBER")%> ( JRN_TNAME <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_VARCHAR", "61")%> not null, JRN_SUBSCRIBER <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_VARCHAR", "400")%> not null, JRN_REFDATE <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_DATE")%> null, JRN_ROW_COUNT <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_NUMERIC", "20")%> null, JRN_DATA_CMD <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_VARCHAR", "2000")%> null, JRN_COUNT_CMD <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_VARCHAR", "2000")%> null, constraint PK_SNP_JRN_SBS primary key (JRN_TNAME, JRN_SUBSCRIBER) )

insCmd = """ insert into <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("SNP_JRN_SUBSCRIBER")%> ( JRN_TNAME, JRN_SUBSCRIBER, JRN_REFDATE, JRN_ROW_COUNT, JRN_DATA_CMD, JRN_COUNT_CMD ) values ( /* JRN_TNAME */ '<%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("FULL_TABLE_NAME")%>', /* JRN_SUBSCRIBER */ ?, /* JRN_REFDATE */ sysdate, /* JRN_ROW_COUNT */ 0, /* JRN_DATA_CMD */ null, /* JRN_COUNT_CMD */ 'update <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("SNP_JRN_SUBSCRIBER")%> <%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> SUBS set SUBS.JRN_ROW_COUNT=(select count(''X'') from <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("JRN_FULL_NAME")%> <%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN where JRN.JRN_SUBSCRIBER=''$$SUBSCRIBER_NAME$$'') where SUBS.JRN_SUBSCRIBER=''$$SUBSCRIBER_NAME$$'' and SUBS.JRN_TNAME = ''<%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("FULL_TABLE_NAME")%>''' ) """
selCmd = """ select count('X') from <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("SNP_JRN_SUBSCRIBER")%> <%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> SUBS where SUBS.JRN_SUBSCRIBER = ? and SUBS.JRN_TNAME = '<%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("FULL_TABLE_NAME")%>' """
# Prepare the statements prepInsStmt = myCon.prepareStatement(insCmd) prepSelStmt = myCon.prepareStatement(selCmd)
# Execute for each subscriber for sbs in lstSbs: prepSelStmt.setString(1, sbs) rs = prepSelStmt.executeQuery() rs.next() nbSubs = rs.getInt(1) if (nbSubs == 0): prepInsStmt.setString(1, sbs) nbRows = prepInsStmt.executeUpdate()
prepInsStmt.close() prepSelStmt.close()
# Commit the updates myCon.commit()

create table <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("JRN_FULL_NAME")%> /* This table is created in the work physical schema of the current Data server */ ( JRN_SUBSCRIBER <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_VARCHAR", "400")%> not null, JRN_CONSUMED <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_VARCHAR", "1")%> null, JRN_FLAG <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_VARCHAR", "1")%> null, JRN_DATE <%=odiRef.getDataType("DEST_DATE")%> null, <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[COL_NAME]\t[DEST_WRI_DT] null", ",\n\t", "", "(PK)")%> )

create or replace view <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("JRN_FULL_VIEW")%> /* This view is created in the work physical schema of the current Data server */ as select decode(TARG.ROWID, null, 'D', 'I') <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN_FLAG, JRN.JRN_SUBSCRIBER <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN_SUBSCRIBER, JRN.JRN_DATE <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN_DATE, <%=odiRef.getColList("", "JRN.[COL_NAME]		" + odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD") + " [COL_NAME]", ",
	", "", "PK")%> <%=odiRef.getColList(",", "TARG.[COL_NAME]		" + odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD") + " [COL_NAME]", ",
	", "", "NOT PK")%> from ( select L.JRN_SUBSCRIBER <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN_SUBSCRIBER, <%=odiRef.getColList("", "L.[COL_NAME]	" + odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD") + " [COL_NAME]", ",
			", ",", "PK")%> max(L.JRN_DATE) <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_COL_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN_DATE from <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("JRN_FULL_NAME")%> <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> L where L.JRN_CONSUMED = '1' group by L.JRN_SUBSCRIBER, <%=odiRef.getColList("", "L.[COL_NAME]", ",
			", "", "PK")%> ) <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> JRN, <%=odiRef.getJrnInfo("FULL_TABLE_NAME")%> <%= odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> TARG where <%=odiRef.getColList("", "JRN.[COL_NAME]	= TARG.[COL_NAME] (+)", "
and	", "", "PK")%>
Demo.JKM Oracle Simple.Cleanup journal for subscribers
